Audio Description: A young homemaker taking a pledge to follow World War II rationing rules is at the center this World War II poster. The upper portion of the poster has a white background. At the top of the poster are the words printed in blue and red ink that read: “Keep the Home Front Pledge.” In a blue circle in the center of the poster is a blonde, blue-eyed woman about 30 years of age holding up her as she takes the pledge. She is wearing a red blouse with white stripes underneath a white apron. Overlapping the circle to her right is a graphic of a hand holding a basket with the words; “Food fights for freedom.” The lower portion of the poster is yellow with the message: “Pay no more than ceiling prices; pay your points in full.”
Creator: United States. Office of Price Administration
Description: Poster, 71 x 51 cm, designer: Fred Cooper
Rights: Materials in this collection are made available by the Illinois State Library. To request reproductions or inquire about permissions, contact:  islimg@ilsos.net. Please cite the item title and collection name.
